intro: Linaria granatensis, commonly known as the granada toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Linaria granatensis is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
